of sociology students have been inspired by the notion of
a "sociological imagination" (a phrase coined by C Wright
Mills) and by the idea of interpreting the world through
a "sociological eye" (a phrase used more recently by Randall
Collins). We all recognise that to achieve the distinctive
understanding of the social world brought by sociology takes
some hard work. To get started and to take you further on
the way to comprehending sociological analysis, you need
books about sociology and books about writing and doing
you will also find it worth buying copies of other sociology
books which interest you because they spark your imagination,
illuminate your understanding of the world, or engage you
because of their interesting subject matter.
